Because number of blocks that associated with cache line are increased. In Direct Mapping every line no has it's multiple blocks that can be only reside in that specific cache line. But with Set Associative Mapping, cache lines within same set can reside other lines' blocks too where it cannot in Direct Mapping. Tag numbers a bit more in Set Associative due to P.A.S. Because they are a bit more in Set Associative, they reside in corresponding set but still in line within that set. So we multiply tag bits with cache line no because Tag Directory stores tag bits resided in cache lines even tho there are a lot more tag numbers.

This is my solution, please correct me if I'm wrong: * Given: No. of Memory Blocks = 4K blocks Size of each Memory Block = 128 words Cache size = 8KB 4 lines per set  ---------------------------- * Solution: P.A.S = No. Blocks * Block Size = 4K * 128 words = 2^12 * 2^7 = 2^19 Bytes => P.A.S = 2^19 -> P.A bits = 19 => Block Size = 2^7 -> Offset = 7 bits Set size = K line(s) * Block Size = 4 * 2^7 = 2^9 Bytes No. of Sets = Cache Size / Set Size = 2^13 / 2^9 = 2^4 Sets -> Set bits = 4 * P.A bits = Tag bits + Set bits + Offset  => Tag bits = P.A bits - (Set bits + Offset) = 19 - (4 + 7) = 8
